meanings.definition: A person who is new to a profession or activity.
meanings.sent1: The rookier asked many questions during the training session.
meanings.sent2: The baseball team welcomed the rookier with open arms.
meanings.sent3: The experienced players teased the rookier in a friendly way.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a rookier in the world of finance, navigating through unfamiliar terms.
meanings.sent5: The rookier's enthusiasm was contagious, inspiring others to learn.

meanings.definition: To act or play like a rookie.
meanings.sent1: He decided to rookier his way through the game, making simple mistakes.
meanings.sent2: She didn't want to rookier during the important match.
meanings.sent3: The seasoned player chuckled as he watched his friend rookier on the field.
meanings.sent4: Trying to rookier in front of the coach only led to embarrassment.
meanings.sent5: The actor had to rookier for the role, learning the basics from scratch.

meanings.definition: To treat someone as if they are a rookie.
meanings.sent1: The coach decided to rookier the new player, giving extra guidance.
meanings.sent2: She didn't appreciate being rookiered by her colleagues.
meanings.sent3: His friends liked to rookier him during their friendly competitions.
meanings.sent4: Being rookiered by the team made her feel underestimated.
meanings.sent5: The teacher didn't want to rookier any student, always offering support and encouragement.
